quizInfo.Subject: Popular Culture
quizInfo.Title: Fifth Module
References: Any external links/handouts should be referenced here

quizData.question: What is the oldest form of information transfer, primarily through materials that can be held by a hand?
Who is attributed with the patent in the movable type which revolutionized printed media?
Where did the earliest printing press appear?
What was perhaps the first national magazine in circulation in the Philippines?
What novel by Umberto Eco discusses how people can be swayed based on what they can read and see?
choices: The Island of the Day Before

quizData.question: What is the Philippines’ first comic strip?
Who are the famous characters created by Mars Ravelo?
Who is the creator of the comic strip “Pupung”?
What is the comic strip created by Apolonio “Pol” Medina, Jr.?
What modern comic was created by Budjette Tan and Kajo Baldisimo?
Who is the creator of the online comic “Sskait”?
Who is the creator of the online comic “Arkitekyuklid”?
What has been shown to have an innate ability to influence, convince, and even enrage listeners?
What went live in 1837, establishing a precedent for modern electronic means of communicating across borders?
Who constructed a high-frequency transformer, an important component of electronic transmitters, in 1891?
Who was ready to transmit the first radio transmission in 1895?
What did Guglielmo Marconi refer to his invention as, since its signal traveled in all directions, i.e., radially, from the transmission point?
Who owned the first three fifty-watt stations, two of which were in Manila and one near Pasay City?
What are the call signs of the first three fifty-watt stations owned by Henry Hermann?
What are the daily fares on most stations in the Philippines, heavily favored by the masses, whether urban or rural?
What is a show which tackles clichéd storylines about abused women, philandering spouses, love’s inequity, and dishonesty?
What is a rising media format for delivering radio-style information and programs to a computer, phone, or media device?
What is a combination of iPod and broadcast?
What are comparable to regular radio programs in that they tend to be chat shows and informational programs on certain themes?
What is the name of Joe Rogan’s podcast?
Who are the duo behind the podcast “Good Mythical Morning”?
quizData.answer: Rhett McLaughlin and Charles Lincoln “Link” Neal III
choices: Rhett McLaughlin and Charles Lincoln “Link” Neal III

quizData.question: What is the name of the podcast by the duo Grace Marcellana and Mimai Cabungson?
What is the name of the podcast by celebrity Bianca Gonzales?
Who invented the first phonograph in 1877?
What is the name of the phonograph that was invented a decade after Thomas Edison’s original design?
Which genre includes the works of eminent composers like Johann Sebastian Bach and Ludwig van Beethoven?
Which genre encompasses all subgenres, including traditional, urban, and rock country?
Which genre is a blend of classics, light opera, and softer rock singles?
Which genre is divided into classic ____ from the 1970s and 1980s and contemporary techno or electronic dance music (EDM)?
Which genre is a mash-up of several genres, including pop, rap, rock, techno, and others?
Which genre incorporates electronic effects and digital instruments?
choices: Rhythm and Blues, Funk, and Soul

quizData.question: Which genre uses non-musical objects to create traditional instruments or sounds?
Which genre employs the use of traditional musical instruments?
Which genre allows people to reflect on their spirituality and get in touch with their inner ethos?
Which genre includes music from all eras and genres of jazz, blues, and swing?
choices: Rhythm and Blues, Funk, and Soul

quizData.question: Which genre mostly includes works from the romantic period?
Which genre includes classic and contemporary works by rap and hip-hop artists?
Which genre includes classic and contemporary performers performing rhythm and blues music, as well as its funk and soul subgenres?
quizData.answer: Rhythm and Blues, Funk, and Soul
choices: Rhythm and Blues, Funk, and Soul

quizData.question: Which genre encompasses all styles of music, past, and present, including old rock and roll, classic rock and roll, jazz rock, folk rock, hard rock, metal rock, industrial rock, grunge, and punk?
Which genre began in the late 1980s in the United Kingdom and has since developed into its own distinct genres, including Britpop and Riot Grrrl, among others?
What type of traditional music in the Philippines is mostly based on the syntactic structure of a Malayan language and connected with village feasts, family activities, and the belief in spirits?
Which type of music in the Philippines is associated with Spanish culture and is often played or accompanied by a plucked-string orchestra?
What is based on photographic technology and includes types such as narrative, documentary, and animated films?
What was invented by French scientist Joseph Nicéphore Niépce and later developed by Louis J. M. Daguerre and William Henry Fox Talbot?
Which type of film is a work of fiction or a portrayal of actual events and goes through stages of preproduction, production, and postproduction?
Which type of film depicts real-life circumstances with people explaining their thoughts and experiences to a camera or interviewer?
Which type of films are narrative stories intended for children and are often created digitally today?
What is an important component of pop culture studies and is often used in scripts for films?
What was the first commercialized home video viewing technology, introduced in the late 1970s?
What was the first Filipino film to win an international award in 1937?
What did local filmmaker Antonio Ramos shoot in 1898 using a Lumiere camera?
Where was a 60mm Gaumont Chrono-photograph projector used to show the first four French films in the Philippines on January 1, 1897?
What was the first television station to broadcast in the Philippines in 1953?
Which broadcasting network was officially born in 1956 when the Lopezes purchased the first television station in the Philippines?
What has had the most rapid expansion in the television business and was established in 1969?
What type of TV networks have been installed to receive broadcast signals from Manila-based stations?
Which foundation has made it possible to produce world-class educational children’s shows in the Philippines?
What is the award-winning show for elementary school students produced by the Philippine Children’s Television Foundation?
What is an entertainment corporation created in 1997 that specializes in streaming media and video-on-demand?
Which Japanese firm took over and improved gaming technology while producing iconic adventure games like Donkey Kong and the Super Mario Brothers?
What term, derived from the medieval Latin verb, is defined as “to direct one’s attention to”?
Which advertising technique uses unconscious archetypal motifs to construct a commercial image?
Which advertising technique refers to the application of visual artists’ practices?
Which advertising technique uses real people and celebrities instead of professional actors?
Which advertising technique is the utilization of popular culture styles, trends, and language to construct advertising messages?
What is a sort of subliminal advertising, impacting people’s thinking without their knowledge?
What is the term for the logical abbreviation of a word or phrase used in digital communication?
What is the term for the language that incorporates various languages and names in creative ways, originally a coded language for the gay community?
What is the term for changing one syllable to a word to give it a new form unique only to those who know them?
What is the term for the deliberate switching of either the word’s entire spelling or syllabic placement?
What is the term for the intentional use of words that have localized versions of the intended words, usually in the form of puns?

What is the term for the usage of words that sound similar to the words that will be used in the conversation, mostly through the use of foreign words whose phonetics have a similar version to the local words?
What is the term for the intentional use of famous celebrity names, whether local or foreign, as descriptors for the intended words?
What is the term for the deliberate usage of foreign words while retaining the foreign word’s meaning?
